Reviews.Title: Good bang for the buck at under $70 on sale
Reviews.Author: Magic Mike "magic mike"
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Inexpensive, decent pictures, good zoom, does with good quality audio, small size, good battery life, feature-rich for the $$$, accepts SD cards for low cost-high volume pictures or video capturing.Cons:  Controls are not intuitive, ANNOYING bright red light that precludes flash, rather cumbersome menu, 9.1 megapixel claim questionable.This is a good, decent, low-buck camera that's full of features.  At $[...] (the amount I paid) it does just about everything I need it to.  I added a 4 GB SD card for ten bucks and I can take up to 995 pictures (or about 35 minutes of video - or a reduced combination of still pics and video).  The 2 (AA) batteries last a good long time.  The LCD viewer is very clear.One of the biggest issues I had when first using this camera was simply taking a picture.  You have to FULLY depress the flash button to get a snapshot.  I took about 30 "focus" shots before I got a picture.  If you gently press the Flash button the picture simply locks into focus.  I had to read the manual to find out how to get a picture.  Just a little more muscle into the Flash finger, and 'Voila!' - photo produced!One thing I question is the 9.1 megapixel claim GE makes, as my 3 year old 3.1 Megapixel FujiFilm S2000 takes pictures that have *slightly* lower resolution - I say this puts together probably 5.5-6 megapixel at best.  Still for the $$$ I paid this is a great deal.So overall this is good for what it is - an inexpensive camera that lets you capture great moments without breaking the bank : and that's a VERY important thing in this economic environment.  Obviously it won't even come close in picture quality to the Canon, Nikon, Sony or other high end cameras.  If you're in the market for top quality pictures and extended lens capability - forget it.  This camera is not for you.  But for good, cheap, decent pictures - consider it a "best buy".  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: I love mine.
Reviews.Author: Victor Hugo
Reviews.Content: Yes, the price is great, but the features are even greater. 5x zoom, blink detection, smile detection, shake detection, panorama, a bunch of different exposure programs. I found the menus very easy. (Read your manual, guys.) I bought a 16 GB SD card. Now this camera is also good for unlimited-time videos. I shot one that lasted 12 minutes. It's tough. I've dropped mine twice on concrete and it still works. The best thing is, it is very stingy with the battery consumption. Even 2 AA alkalines last a long time. No frustrations with this camera. My photos have been sharp. Thanks, GE, for packing so much into a small device at a small price.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money but not for any one who wants real photography.
Reviews.Author: San Jose Guy "Kapi"
Reviews.Content: This is a great toy, that's all its is, after all what can you expect for 70$???. Its easy to use has some nice features like the auto scene and overall user interface is quite good. Battery life is very decent. In good lighting the pictures are quite OK but try any thing in low light and the image quality drops sharply. Trying to capture night scenes is almost impossible, the images come out black and white almost no color. Flash photography is OK in ranges of 1 to 15 feet but there is a very serious picture to picture gap when using flash.Auto Focus works OK in most cases but misses the mark at least 10%. If you do have this camera I suggest taking every picture twice for redundancy. The 5X optical zoom is good and useful but forget about the digital zoom its horrible. Last and most annoying is the inability to control how much an image is compressed and processed. The images captured at 9MP undergo such heavy JPG compression that the quality is reduced to a 6MP camera equivalent. If I could select minimal compression i could live with the image quality but as its is now the 9MP is simply not being utilized to its fullest. Its a great camera for beginners, people who need an easy point and shoot and people on the budget. Its nothing more than a cool toy but for 70$ its definitely a good buy if you are looking for imaging on the cheap side. Would I buy it for myself - never. Would I buy it for my mother or a young teen - oh yeah.

Reviews.Title: It should be a crime that it's so cheap.
Reviews.Author: Dellane
Reviews.Content: When I embarked on buying a new camera, I had 4 requirements that had to be met. Firstly, the megapixel had to be between 8-10 Megapixels. Secondly, the optical zoom had to be between 4-5X. Thirdly, it had to have a digital zoom of 4-5X. Finally, the price had to be less than $120.I spent hours reading reviews from many websites but couldn't find a new camera that satisfied all these requirements for under $120. At first, when I found this camera on Tiger Direct's website, I was hesitant because it seemed too good to be true. After getting over the shock that it met all my requirements and the price was under $100, I decided to buy it.Can I tell you that this camera has amazing clarity. Even the the video capture is amazingly clear. It's a steal!

Reviews.Title: Great little P&S; camera
Reviews.Author: S. Allen "toy and book tragic"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for a 6yo who really showed an interest in photography.  The controls are easy enough to use that the same 6yo, without reading the manual has been able to take good quality pictures and video, and use some of the advanced features such as auto-timing (to let her take pictures of herself with the dog!)

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Hanggle
Reviews.Content: The GE A950 camera works good.  My previous Nikon S4 quit working due to a common problem of that model.  So I decided to switch to a U.S brand instead of a Japanese brand.  It turns out pretty nice.Some pros are:  5x optical zoom is better than the standard 3x zoom camera.  AA batteries are much easier 2 find than lithium batteries.  Scenes Function is really handy  It is light.  The brightness of the LCD is automatic adjusted and really clear under all environment.The cons are:  at wide angle side, the barrel distortions is pretty obvious, but can be fixed with software  the built-in panorama maker is not so effective.  batteries drains kinda fast (about 120-200 pics) but I use rechargeable batteries and 15-minute quick charger so it is not really a problem 4 me.Over all it is a excellent camera for that price

Reviews.Title: Neat little camera
Reviews.Author: Dwayne K. Bennett "Mtneer"
Reviews.Content: The GE A950 has so many features that I still have not used them all.  My friends like the panorama feature the best.  On a recent trip to London I was able to provide some great pictures of the sights there including Windsor castle. Camera performs most admirably outside and pretty good inside within a few feet, otherwise the pictures are dark. Use the features of this camera to get the best results such as stabilization etc. Hold still when taking pics.  I carry it with me on all of my trips it replaced a 6 Megapixel Fuji portable.

Reviews.Title: A good, cheap camera.
Reviews.Author: Maine AV8R
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to leave at work for when I didn't have my real camera. I work as a DJ and often have the need to take pictures, but don't want to lug an expensive camera into a bar(They get stolen or beer soaked). I didn't want to spend a lot of money, on what was technically a "spare" camera even though it is the only camera I bring to work.That said:  It's a decent camera. It uses AA batteries so you'll rarely be in a situation where you can't find batteries. The picture quality is passable. Much better than a Camera Phone, not nearly as nice as a $150-$200 camera.The auto-focus is hit or miss. Overall, I can see it being a major pain in the butt if this is your only camera. This is not the camera you want to use to preserve "once-in-a-lifetime" events. Make sure you can re-shoot if necessary, or that you can live without the picture.For snapping photos of people singing Karaoke, dancing or an occasional photo-op... it's a great little camera to have around.It's loaded with features that make it fun to use.Well-planned out buttons and menus.If you're capturing your child's first steps, or documenting your biggest vacation ever... pony-up the cash and buy a real camera. (Even a low end Panasonic Lumix takes much better pictures, at only $50 more. (Remember, mega-pixels are a selling gimmick, and have no effect whatsoever on the image quality. Image quality is based on the Lens and the Image Sensor and the internal electronics, all of which are budget grade in this camera. 9.1mp of noise is simply noise.)As a camera to keep in the glove box for those unexpected photo opportunities... It's a no-brainer. You won't find a more feature rich camera with passable results at this price (I paid $[...] w/free shipping)

Reviews.Title: Smile!!!
Reviews.Author: Peter Penn "Pete"
Reviews.Content: OK, I picked a cheezey title but this camera is way more amazing than some are giving credit for.  Occasionally I'll get a blurry pic if I'm not careful but most of them are way beyond what I expected.  I've had a walking person in mixed light turn out blurry, probably, because I wiggled or because of the mixed light but I also caught a mountain waterfall with bits of flying water stunningly frozen in time.I have a nice Canon XTi DSLR and a very nice lens for it that I got for nature photography.  Trouble is, on most backpacking trips I have enough weight already so I bought this little GE jewel for portability that I could keep handy in a front pocket.  Unless I expect to need serious magnification, the DSLR will stay home and might even get sold if idle for too long.I'd read in one or two reviews that having the camera set on full 9MP might make it more apt to blur so I set it on 5MP for now.  Honestly, the menu is not so difficult if you study it a little.  It is definitely way easier than most I've seen but still manages many features.  It doesn't take long, even without peeking at the manual, to scroll through every part of the menu and get a complete understanding (but do read the manual).  I admit I had doubts about the "smile detection" feature and didn't even notice it has its own button till a couple days ago when I tried it.  I wanted to get myself in a group shot and forgot where to turn on the self-timer.  Rather than look in the menus, I told my friends to not smile till I got in the pic and gave them a cue.  I pushed the :-) button, pressed the shutter button halfway down to focus, then pushed it down, and walked over and got in the group.  Then, as soon as we all smiled, we heard the shutter trip. Haha!  It worked and even served as a self-timer!  I guess for serious or scowling shots, I'd have to use the real self-timer.Anyway, after reviews I'd read had me thinking I might be returning this camera, it is definitely a keeper!  For those with the blurry shots, ALWAYS push the shutter button part way till it focuses, then take your shot.  If that didn't fix things, try lowering the pixel range to 5MP.  You still get a hi-def shot twice as big as a 17" monitor screen and needing to be reduced.I don't expect this to send my HD video cam packing but the little video shots I've tried were also very impressive.  I'm wishing I had thought to take a 5 second moving snapshot of that waterfall.  I'm sounding like an ad.  A short review would be too short.  Lastly, a tip... if you try to get a macro shot of a flower and have trouble focusing, put your hand beside the flower and focus on it, hold that focus, move your hand, and shoot the flower.

Reviews.Title: GE A950-BK 9MP Digital camera A+++++
Reviews.Author: Clem
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the operation of this camera.  The pictures are very clearand the camera is small enough to take in your purse.  We haven't had it very long,but the batteries have lasted through several hours of pictures.  We would recommendthis camera for anyone.  For the price, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: believer
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, handy camera.  The size is small enough to take anywhere and yet the quality is very good.  The price is very reasonable and I am happy with this purchase.  I bought this for a gift and want one for myself now.

Reviews.Title: Not good for me
Reviews.Author: Thomas Bays
Reviews.Content: The good is that the picture are ehhhhh....OK.  Not as good as my old Nikon Coolpix 2.  The camera does have a lot of nice features and would be great for a youngster up to about 13 or an after thought camera for an adult.Don't use this as your main camera if you can help it.  The flash is horrible and my kids look like Vampires they are so washed out and white.  If you can get the flash to not go crazy it is an alright (being very nice) camera.I can't recommend though as a serious camera and that probably isn't what most folks who buy this camera expect.  That is why I give it a 2 instead of 1.I got it for $49...so no harm done.  That flash though...yuck.

Reviews.Title: Not a "WOW-WHAT-A-STEAL"but adequate for the money
Reviews.Author: C. RIVERA "guanime"
Reviews.Content: I have not had a lot of experience with it but I have shot over 100 pictures inside my house and on cloudy days. The picture quality is good. It is fairly easy to use but I am really going to reserve my final judgment until I have shot more at home and in low light. Definitely, not better than comparable Canon and Fuji cameras my friends have but again I paid little ($60) so I am not going to fuss much.

Reviews.Title: Bad performance
Reviews.Author: P. SHADWELL Jr. "Applied Science 'R' Us"
Reviews.Content: I believe the unit I received was defective.  It is hard to believe that GE would intensionaly sell this to the public.The image quality was never very good.  Noisy and low color saturation.  The main issue was that the auto focus seemed to have a mind of its own.  While mounted on a tripod with people posing in front of the Christmas tree, half of the pictures were out of focus.  We took successive shots with the same setup and get a variety of results.Great price lousy pictures.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Lorri69
Reviews.Content: Great product for the price, does very well. My husband takes this on the road with him as he is an otr driver, and he takes some beautiful pics with out a lot of hassle.

Reviews.Title: can't say anything bad.
Reviews.Author: Didina Burok "didina"
Reviews.Content: I've had this unit for over 3 years. After the first 6 months my husband wanted it, so he's been using it since. He is very rough on things and carries it on his belt every day. Although the markings on the camera are all but gone, the camera has survived and is still taking very decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done
Reviews.Author: linda jane
Reviews.Content: I hardly ever take this camera out any more, as I have a smart-phone now that takes up less space in my pocket and is also a phone, a computer, a calculator, and an alarm clock. It was a different era when I bought this camera. A more innocent time. A time when phones were attached to the wall, and computers took up entire buildings.Still takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Decent extra camera
Reviews.Author: RC
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an extra camera to leave in my motorcycle and wanted one that used regular batteries instead of built in rechargeable batteries so I wouldn't have to worry about remembering to charge it regularly.  I just carry a spare pair of batteries in the carrying case and I know I'm always ready to take pictures.  Only downside is you will burn through a set of batteries in an afternoon of taking pictures at say, auto races or some such.

Reviews.Title: Return without use as I did not need it.
Reviews.Author: Christopher D. Kelosky
Reviews.Content: Return without use as I did not need it.  The vendor I bought it from did take the return back.

Reviews.Title: Excellent low cost camera, can't beat the price/performance
Reviews.Author: AeroEngineer
Reviews.Content: PROS: uses standard storage SD and SDHC, 9MP more than enough, 5X zoom, Durable materials,  uses standard batteries, easy to use, priceCONS: uses non standard PC connector(2012), a rechargeable battery would be nice, internal storage holds about 20 picturesDigital cameras for normal use are a ripoff in general now, this one is great at it's current prices though! If you have an average smartphone or camera phone(at least 5MP) you don't need  to buy a digital camera. That being said I have a below average Straight talk phone, but the camera is 1.2MP with NO FLASH, resulting in grainy dark pictures. I sell a lot of stuff on ebay so I need good pictures, clear and bright. Going to the store nets you a 40+tax dollar 5MP piece of junk that is all plastic with some no name brand.And it's tricky to make sure what kind of storage card you will need too. Fortunately this uses both a standard SD and SDHC which everyone uses for many different things now. I'm using a micro SD with an adapter on this with no problems, another plus. The connector is the typical smaller camera one, which is a pain. If this had used standard micro USB to PC connector it would be better.9MP is about 4MP more than anyone needs for normal use so it's a bonus. Materials are high quality heavier plastics and metals. I've never dropped it so I can't say if it would be ok or not but it feels like it would if it's on carpet.This is a great camera at a decent price used in today's market, 2012. I got this for about 10 bucks less including shipping on the other major online seller so there are even better deals out there than here! Recommended!

Reviews.Title: OK for so cheap a unit.Doesn't break down.
Reviews.Author: David J. Geiger "BlessedRmeek"
Reviews.Content: Hi. I am doing confession and hoping for absolution of my sin. I bought this camera used for my wife. She wanted a smaller camera than the old 7.1 mp Olympus. It is marginally smaller and that satisfied her. We use E2 Lithium AA batteries and they last forever. I was using a Kodak ZD710 at the time and this cameras 9.1mp was a seeming upgrade for her.However , in reviewing the pictures in her memory I found quite a few with blurred motion.Badly Blurred. My son has taken some videos on it, But I can't tell how(by reading the manual)how to play a video on the camera's screen.My son is 10,so I quess I should ask him. I have since sold my Kodak and upgraded to a Nikon S8100 for myself.Now I feel a bit GUILTY for having her use this out of date model. But, my S8100 definently doesn't qualify as a small light camera for her purse.For Valentines day Im thinking of getting her a Samsung PL210 as a good concealed carry camera.It is lots thinner and slicker looking.If I can get her to read the manual maybe she can get better results. I looked at the reviews on the Nikon S3100 and S4100 and didn't like what I saw.BAD LENS problems.Well at least I can say This GE A950 hasn't broken down on my wife.It hasn't given her anything to complain about. It therefore, has been a successful purchase.It will probably keep on working as good as it does for another 10 years.Now I hope to show my gal that I want to bless her with a better camera and have a Good Valentines Day!

Reviews.Title: Replace
Reviews.Author: repaint
Reviews.Content: I contacted the vendor and let them know the camera worked about one day and I either need it fixed or replaced.They called me up and said they would forward a new one that is one step better on the megapixals from 9 to a 10.I have not recieved yet but expect to shortly.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, nice pictures
Reviews.Author: A. Blaylock "an Oprah Book Club lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this on sale for about $80. I wanted a camera that was easy for this not-very-technical girl to handle, but still do all I wanted it to do. I figured it out totally in a couple hours. The pics are really crisp, uploading and emailing them is easy, and even my kids can use it. I like the zoom alot, also. I don't know much about cameras other than the better the MP the better pic you get. This camera was not too hard to learn to operate, takes really nice pictures,and will zoom when I need it too. I will add too, that's it's very light-weight and fits fine in my purse.

Reviews.Title: Fools the unobservant - too good for the price. BUY IT!
Reviews.Author: Omoge
Reviews.Content: This video is good trust me. I believe most people giving it a bad review either didn't bother to read the manual that came with it or I really just don't know.This is a good camera that does so many things.There are so many functions that it's imperative to take a few minutes to read the manual and get a hang of it.It even has an automatic panoramic function.If you don't bother to get to know it, you might get not so good picture quality.I was looking to buy a camera and I was initially wary of buying a not so well-known camera.Trust me, this has been better than expected.So if you are still sitting on the fence, BUY IT

Reviews.Title: great camera at super price
Reviews.Author: Patrick UM
Reviews.Content: it was super cheap, it has been a great buy, the camera was packed in a blister and its got no holster but its been great, it doesnt have webcam feature but the panoramic is good and resolution is ok, will buy another one for my parents.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Sweet
Reviews.Content: Went from a Canon Elphe to this cheapo.  I was surprisingly impressed.  The battery life is very good, pictures are great. Video and audio very nice as well.  I think this camera has a better microphone than many other more expensive cameras.  The wide lens w 5x Zoom is just that little extra I need with many only having a 3x optical zoom.  This camera is quite solid and feels sturdy.  Transferring files to and from camera is as straight forward as any simple external drive, flash card, usb drive etc. This was not the case with my Canon. Many people seem to have a hard time getting good shots with this. To use image stabilization you must set the dial to image stabilization mode and out of the standard camera mode.  This is probably other reviewers problems.  Helps to learn a little about working the camera before writing a review.The only Con I have is that it is a larger camera than the very tiny Canon Elph.  At 1/5 the cost who cares!  I use energizer rechargeable batteries & I have NO complaints about the battery life.

Reviews.Title: Waste of Money
Reviews.Author: PoisonGrl21
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in April (from K-Mart, not Amazon) and at first I was really pleased with the quality of the pictures that it took. But then in July the camera randomly started displaying lines through every photo I took. I have looked at all of the camera's settings and I can not figure out what is wrong with it. I have never dropped it or anything. I have tried several different things to get rid of the lines and nothing works. It really was a disappointment as the camera did take really nice pictures for the 3 months that it worked. I have since switched back to my Kodak Easyshare and suggest you buy one of those instead of this piece of crap.

Reviews.Title: For the price it's ok as a backup camera. Just in Case?
Reviews.Author: jmindito
Reviews.Content: Its ok as a back-up 2nd Camera to have around in the Home/Office for the just in case...Pros:+ Price and Size+ Decent Quality+ Good battery life+ Uses Standard AA batteries and SD Card+ Has some built in memoryCons- Average picture quality (for computer use only) Prints are not that good.- Poor quality in low lighting (esp. video)I neither like nor dislike this camera but it does serve its purpose.

Reviews.Title: for the price
Reviews.Author: felix valderrama
Reviews.Content: it is lot of camera for the money.It make avery good gift for a beginner.

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: Robert Winters
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter as a Christmas gift.She is very happy with the camera and i get pictures of the grandkids so I'm very happyIt's a win win situation.Thanks Amazon

Reviews.Title: GE A950
Reviews.Author: RF
Reviews.Content: Arrived ahead of schedule and as advertised.  A great camera at a great price!

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price.
Reviews.Author: C. Paul
Reviews.Content: Works much better than the cameras I had before. Very good price for the product.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Stacy Zabinski
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 8 year old daughter for Christmas.  She loves it.  She really loves the making her own short videos too.  The only problem is I wish it had a rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: Really good camera!
Reviews.Author: Benny Gomez "Engineer"
Reviews.Content: Its a really good camera, the only inconvenient its the battery life it use AA battery, but for the price its works great and do the job, i put the photos on my HDTV and they look awesome, it really its 9 MP

Reviews.Title: POS!!
Reviews.Author: RW....NY
Reviews.Content: Save your money...this camera is not worth it at any price!  I thought I was buying an inexpensive everyday camera that would be good to take on vacations.  I was right about one thing...it is inexpensive.  It is cheaply made and broke the first time I used it.I received it for a gift and after only taking a few pictures the LCD screen broke.  I contacted Tiger Direct and after telling them my problem, they refused to make good on the product and told me I had to contact the manufacturer....which I did.  GE was glad to help me and fix the camera, but for a price.  Practically the price of the camera itself and with shipping and all, it would have cost me more to fix it than to buy a new one.  NO THANK YOU.  I then put a claim into Amazon and they were no help at all.  So now I am stuck with a camera that is broken.  The camera is so poorly made and light that I can't even use it for a paper weight.I guess the old adage of "you get what you pay for" applies here to the letter.  I will never buy from anything that Tiger Direct sells on Amazon again, nor will I think that Amazon puts their customers first.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality Pictures, Good Price
Reviews.Author: M. White
Reviews.Content: So far I have taken about 100 pictures.  I do not believe that it comes close to the 9.1MP that it is advertised as.Photos with the sun in the background are dark.  Close ups are out of focus.  The image stabilization mode is a joke.My suggestion is to save a little more money and buy a Nikon camera.The is a good camera if you want to take 20 pictures and have one semi decent result.
